div.p: RAICHUR . a town of India, in the state of Hyderabad, at the junction of the Madras and Great Indian Peninsula railways, 351 ni. N.E. from Madras. Pop. (1901) 22,165. It gives its name to the doab, or tract between the rivers Kistna and Tunga-bhadra, which was the scene of much fighting between Mahom-medans and Hindus as debatable land during the 16th century. It contains a well-preserved fort and two old mosques. It is a thriving centre of trade, with several cotton-presses.
